publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4572 Jackie Baillie: National Parks’ Week - 21 to 28 July 2006—That the Parliament notes that 21 to 28 July is National Parks’ Week 2006; acknowledges that the purpose of this week is to raise awareness of national parks and celebrate their beauty, diversity and individual qualities; recognises that Scotland’s first national park at Loch Lomond and the Trossachs will be running a number of activities, including walks and exhibitions; further notes that all 14 parks across the United Kingdom are a nationally important recreational resource attracting approximately 100 million visitors a year and are an important part of the nation’s heritage and economy that will be safeguarded for future generations to enjoy, and commends the Scottish Executive on bringing forward legislation early in the lifetime of the Scottish Parliament to create national parks. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S2M-4572 National Parks’ Week - 21 to 28 July 2006 (lodged on 19 June 2006) Karen Gillon*, Robin Harper*, Cathie Craigie*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Alex Fergusson*, Maureen Macmillan*, Mr David Davidson*, Mike Pringle*, Helen Eadie*, Trish Godman*, Carolyn Leckie*, Bill Butler*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Patrick Harvie*
S2M-4572 National Parks’ Week - 21 to 28 July 2006 (lodged on 19 June 2006) Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Sarah Boyack*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-4572 National Parks’ Week - 21 to 28 July 2006 (lodged on 19 June 2006) Donald Gorrie*, Karen Whitefield*, Roseanna Cunningham*

S2M-4572 Jackie Baillie: National Parks’ Week - 21 to 28 July 2006—That the Parliament notes that 21 to 28 July is National Parks’ Week 2006; acknowledges that the purpose of this week is to raise awareness of national parks and celebrate their beauty, diversity and individual qualities; recognises that Scotland’s first national park at Loch Lomond and the Trossachs will be running a number of activities, including walks and exhibitions; further notes that all 14 parks across the United Kingdom are a nationally important recreational resource attracting approximately 100 million visitors a year and are an important part of the nation’s heritage and economy that will be safeguarded for future generations to enjoy, and commends the Scottish Executive on bringing forward legislation early in the lifetime of the Scottish Parliament to create national parks. Supported by: Karen Gillon, Robin Harper, Cathie Craigie, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Alex Fergusson, Maureen Macmillan, Mr David Davidson, Mike Pringle, Helen Eadie, Trish Godman, Carolyn Leckie, Bill Butler, Mr Jamie Stone, Patrick Harvie, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Sarah Boyack, Chris Ballance, Donald Gorrie, Karen Whitefield, Roseanna Cunningham, Dennis Canavan*
S2M-4572 National Parks’ Week - 21 to 28 July 2006 (lodged on 19 June 2006) Cathy Peattie*
S2M-4572 National Parks’ Week - 21 to 28 July 2006 (lodged on 19 June 2006) Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-4572 National Parks’ Week - 21 to 28 July 2006 (lodged on 19 June 2006) Linda Fabiani*
